BiblioData.Title: Process for the preparation of fibrous carbon.
BiblioData.Abstract: Process for the preparation of fibrous carbon which comprises contacting a metallic catalyst with a carbon-containing gas at elevated temperature, characterized in that said catalyst is sponge iron.

Claims.P: 1. A process for the preparation of fibrous carbon which comprises contacting a metallic catalyst with a carbon-containing gas at elevated temperature, characterized in that said catalyst is sponge iron.

2. A method for the conversion into carbon of gaseous hydrocarbons extracted from a natural hydrocarbon reservoir, which method comprises contacting said gaseous hydrocarbon at an elevated temperature in a reactor with a catalyst capable of converting said hydrocarbon to carbon and hydrogen; separating hydrogen produced from unconverted hydrocarbon; burning said hydrogen to generate energy; and using the energy generated to heat said reactor or the gaseous hydrocarbon flow thereto, or to heat or power a heat or power consuming apparatus.
3. A method as claimed in claim 2 wherein the energy generated is used to heat said reactor or the gaseous hydrocarbon flow thereto.
4. A method as claimed in claim 2 wherein the energy generated is used to power an electricity generator.
5. A method as claimed in any one of claims 2 to 4, wherein said catalyst is particulate.
6. A method as claimed in any one of claims 2 to 5 wherein said catalyst is a Raney metal.
7. A method as claimed in any one of claims 2 to 5 wherein said catalyst comprises an element selected from Ni, Co and Fe.
8. A method as claimed in any one of claims 2 to 7 wherein said catalyst is particulate with a mode particle size of 1 to 300 m.
9. A method as claimed in any one of claims 2 to 8 wherein hydrogen is burned in an internal combustion engine.
10. A method as claimed in any one of claims 2 to 9 wherein the hydrogen is separated from the unconverted hydrocarbon using a hydrogen-permeable membrane.
11. An apparatus for the conversion of hydrocarbon gas to carbon, said apparatus comprising a reactor vessel (2) having a gas inlet port (18) and a gas outlet port (19);
a separator (4) for removing hydrogen from a hydrocarbon and hydrogen containing gas;
a gas conduit (3) from said gas outlet port to said separator;
a combustor (9) arranged to burn hydrogen from said separator to generate energy; and
an energy transferrer (11) arranged to transfer energy from said combustor to said reactor vessel or to a further heat or power consuming apparatus (20).
12. An apparatus as claimed in claim 11 further comprising an electricity generator (20) powered by energy from said combustor.
